1 /**
  2  * Emily
  3  * Copyright(c) 2012 Olivier Scherrer <pode.fr@gmail.com>
  4  * MIT Licensed
  5  */
  6 
  7 define("CouchDBStore", 
  8 
  9 ["Store", "StateMachine", "Tools", "Promise"], 
 10 
 11 /**
 12  * @class
 13  * CouchDBStore synchronises a Store with a CouchDB view or document
 14  * It subscribes to _changes to keep its data up to date.
 15  */
 16 function CouchDBStore(Store, StateMachine, Tools, Promise) {
 17 	
 18 	/**
 19 	 * Defines the CouchDBStore
 20 	 * @returns {CouchDBStoreConstructor}
 21 	 */
 22 	function CouchDBStoreConstructor() {
 23 		
 24 		/**
 25 		 * The name of the channel on which to run the requests
 26 		 * @private
 27 		 */
 28 		var _channel = "CouchDB",
 29 		
 30 		/**
 31 		 * The transport used to run the requests
 32 		 * @private
 33 		 */
 34 		_transport = null,
 35 		
 36 		/**
 37 		 * The database name
 38 		 * @private
 39 		 */
 40 		_database = null,
 41 		
 42 		/**
 43 		 * The name of the view
 44 		 * @private
 45 		 */
 46 		_view = null,
 47 		
 48 		/**
 49 		 * The name of the document
 50 		 * @private
 51 		 */
 52 		_document = null,
 53 		
 54 		/**
 55 		 * The name of the design document
 56 		 * @private
 57 		 */
 58 		_design = null,
 59 		
 60 		/**
 61 		 * An object to store info like update_sq
 62 		 * @private
 63 		 */
 64 		_dbInfo = {},
 65 		
 66 		/**
 67 		 * The promise that is returned by sync
 68 		 * It's resolved when entering listening state
 69 		 * It's rejected when no such document to sync to
 70 		 * @private
 71 		 */
 72 		_syncPromise = new Promise(),
 73 		
 74 		/**
 75 		 * The state machine
 76 		 * @private
 77 		 * it concentrates almost the whole logic.
 78 		 * It can already be extended to handle reconnect for instance
 79 		 */
 80 		_stateMachine = new StateMachine("Unsynched", {
 81 			"Unsynched": [
 82 			              
 83 			 ["getView", function () {
 84 					_transport.request(_channel, {
 85 						method: "GET",
 86 						path: "/" + _database + "/_design/" + _design + "/" + "_view/" + _view +"?update_seq=true"
 87 					}, function (results) {
 88 						var json = JSON.parse(results);
 89 						_dbInfo = {
 90 								total_rows: json.total_rows,
 91 								update_seq: json.update_seq,
 92 								offset: json.offset
 93 						};
 94 						
 95 						this.reset(json.rows);
 96 						_stateMachine.event("subscribeToViewChanges", json.update_seq);
 97 					}, this);
 98 				}, this, "Synched"],
 99 				
100 				["getDocument", function () { 
101 					_transport.request(_channel, {
102 						method: "GET",
103 						path: "/" + _database + "/" + _document
104 					}, function (results) {
105 						var json = JSON.parse(results);
106 						if (json._id) {
107 							this.reset(json);
108 							_stateMachine.event("subscribeToDocumentChanges");	
109 						} else {
110 							_syncPromise.reject(this);
111 						}
112 					}, this);
113 				}, this, "Synched"]],
114 						
115 			"Synched": [
116 			            
117 	            ["updateDatabase", function () {
118 	            	_transport.request(_channel, {
119 	            		method: "PUT",
120 	            		path: '/' + _database + '/' + _document,
121 	            		headers: {
122 	            			"Content-Type": "application/json"
123 	            		},
124 	            		data: this.toJSON()
125 	            	}, function () {
126 	            		_stateMachine.event("subscribeToDocumentChanges");
127 	            	});
128 	            }, this],
129 			           
130 			  ["subscribeToViewChanges", function (update_seq) {
131 					_transport.listen(_channel
132 					, "/" + _database + "/_changes?feed=continuous&heartbeat=20000&since="+update_seq
133 					, function (changes) {
134 						// Should I test for this very special case (heartbeat?)
135 						// Or do I have to try catch for any invalid json?
136 						if (changes == "\n") {
137 							return false;
138 						}
139 						
140 						var json = JSON.parse(changes),
141 							action;
142 
143 						if (json.deleted) {
144 							action = "delete";
145 						} else if (json.changes[0].rev.search("1-") == 0) {
146 							action = "add";
147 						} else {
148 							action = "change";
149 						}
150 						_stateMachine.event(action, json.id);
151 					}, this);
152 				}, this, "Listening"],
153 				
154 				["subscribeToDocumentChanges", function () {
155 					_transport.listen(_channel
156 					, "/" + _database + "/_changes?feed=continuous&heartbeat=20000"
157 					, function (changes) {
158 						var json;
159 						// Should I test for this very special case (heartbeat?)
160 						// Or do I have to try catch for any invalid json?
161 						if (changes == "\n") {
162 							return false;
163 						}
164 						
165 						json = JSON.parse(changes);
166 						
167 						// The document is the modified document is the current one
168 						if (json.id == _document && 
169 							// And if it has a new revision
170 							json.changes.pop().rev != this.get("_rev")) {
171 							
172 							if (json.deleted) {
173 								_stateMachine.event("deleteDoc");
174 							} else {
175 								_stateMachine.event("updateDoc");	
176 							}
177 						 }
178 					}, this);
179 				}, this, "Listening"]],
180 				
181 			"Listening": [
182 			              
183 	              ["entry", function () {
184 	            	  _syncPromise.resolve(this);
185 	              }, this],
186 			              
187 			    ["change", function (id) {
188 					_transport.request(_channel,{
189 						method: "GET",
190 						path: '/'+_database+'/_design/'+_design+'/_view/'+_view
191 					}, function (view) {
192 						var json = JSON.parse(view);
193 						
194 						json.rows.some(function (value, idx) {
195 							if (value.id == id) {
196 								this.set(idx, value);
197 							}
198 						}, this);
199 
200 						
201 					}, this);
202 					
203 				}, this],
204 				
205 				["delete", function (id) {
206 					this.loop(function (value, idx) {
207 						if (value.id == id) {
208 							this.del(idx);
209 						}
210 					}, this);
211 				}, this],
212 				
213 				["add", function (id) {
214 					_transport.request(_channel,{
215 						method: "GET",
216 						path: '/'+_database+'/_design/'+_design+'/_view/'+_view
217 					}, function (view) {
218 						var json = JSON.parse(view);
219 						
220 						json.rows.some(function (value, idx) {
221 							if (value.id == id) {
222 								this.alter("splice", idx, 0, value);	
223 							}
224 						}, this);
225 						
226 					}, this);
227 				}, this],
228 				
229 				["updateDoc", function () {
230 					_transport.request(_channel,{
231 						method: "GET",
232 						path: '/'+_database+'/' + _document
233 					}, function (doc) {
234 						this.reset(JSON.parse(doc));			
235 					}, this);
236 			    }, this],
237 			    
238 			    ["deleteDoc", function () {
239 			    	this.reset({});			
240 			    }, this],
241 			    
242 			    ["updateDatabase", function () {
243 			    	_transport.request(_channel, {
244 	            		method: "PUT",
245 	            		path: '/' + _database + '/' + _document,
246 	            		headers: {
247 	            			"Content-Type": "application/json"
248 	            		},
249 	            		data: this.toJSON()
250 	            	});
251 			    }, this],
252 			    
253 			    ["removeFromDatabase", function () {
254 			    	_transport.request(_channel, {
255 	            		method: "DELETE",
256 	            		path: '/' + _database + '/' + _document + '?rev=' + this.get("_rev")
257 	            	});
258 			    }, this]
259 			   ]
260 			
261 		});
262 		
263 		/**
264 		 * Synchronize the store with a view
265 		 * @param {String} database the name of the database where to get...
266 		 * @param {String} ...design the design document, in which...
267 		 * @param {String} view ...the view is.
268 		 * @returns {Boolean}
269 		 */
270 		this.sync = function sync() {
271 			if (typeof arguments[0] == "string" && typeof arguments[1] == "string" && typeof arguments[2] == "string") {
272 				_database = arguments[0];
273 				_design = arguments[1];
274 				_view = arguments[2];
275 				_stateMachine.event("getView");
276 				return _syncPromise;
277 			} else if (typeof arguments[0] == "string" && typeof arguments[1] == "string" && typeof arguments[2] == "undefined") {
278 				_database = arguments[0];
279 				_document = arguments[1];
280 				_stateMachine.event("getDocument");
281 				return _syncPromise;
282 			}
283 			return false;
284 		};
285 		
286 		/**
287 		 * Update the database with the current document
288 		 * @returns true if update called
289 		 */
290 		this.update = function update() {
291 			return _stateMachine.event("updateDatabase");
292 		};
293 		
294 		/**
295 		 * Remove the document from the database
296 		 * @returns true if remove called
297 		 */
298 		this.remove = function remove() {
299 			return _stateMachine.event("removeFromDatabase");
300 		};
301 		
302 		/**
303 		 * Get a specific info about the current view
304 		 * Should be used only for debugging
305 		 * @param {String} name (update_seq/offset/total_rows)
306 		 * Note: if you want to get the number of items, store.getNbItems() is the func for that
307 		 * @returns the info
308 		 */
309 		this.getDBInfo = function getDBInfo(name) {
310 			return _dbInfo[name];
311 		};
312 		
313 		/**
314 		 * The transport object to use
315 		 * @param {Object} transport the transport object
316 		 * @returns {Boolean} true if 
317 		 */
318 		this.setTransport = function setTransport(transport) {
319 			if (transport && typeof transport.listen == "function" && typeof transport.request == "function") {
320 				_transport = transport;
321 				return true;
322 			} else {
323 				return false;
324 			}
325 		};
326 		
327 		/**
328 		 * Get the state machine
329 		 * Also only useful for debugging
330 		 * @returns {StateMachine} the state machine
331 		 */
332 		this.getStateMachine = function getStateMachine() {
333 			return _stateMachine;
334 		};
335 		
336 		/**
337 		 * Get the current transport
338 		 * Also only useful for debugging
339 		 * @returns {Object} the current transport
340 		 */
341 		this.getTransport = function getTransport() {
342 			return _transport;
343 		};
344 
345 	};
346 	
347 	return function CouchDBStoreFactory() {
348 		CouchDBStoreConstructor.prototype = new Store;
349 		return new CouchDBStoreConstructor;
350 	};
351 	
352 });
